meanings.definition: Treat (cotton fabric) with caustic soda to give it a lustrous appearance.
meanings.sent1: She decided to mercerize her cotton dress to make it shiny.
meanings.sent2: The tailor will mercerize the fabric to make it look glossy.
meanings.sent3: Why did the cotton shirt go to the spa? To get mercerized and shine bright!
meanings.sent4: After the treatment, the fabric seemed to mercerize under the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The magician waved his wand, and the cotton fabric mercerized into a dazzling display.

meanings.definition: Make (cotton fabric) lustrous by treating it in the same way.
meanings.sent1: They will mercerize the cloth to give it a shiny finish.
meanings.sent2: The process of mercerizing cotton makes it look more elegant.
meanings.sent3: The cotton material felt proud after being mercerized to perfection.
meanings.sent4: Her smile mercerized the room, brightening everyone's day.
meanings.sent5: The stars in the night sky mercerized the darkness with their shimmering glow.
